author: Donald A. Norman
title: Living with Complexity
description: Why we don't really want simplicity, and how we can learn to live with complexity.

author: Steve Krug
title: Don't Make Me Think, Revisited
description: A common-sense approach to web usability that remains a UX design classic.

author: Donald A. Norman
title: The Design of Everyday Things
description: A foundational text in design thinking that explains how design serves as the communication between object and user.

author: Jesse James Garrett
title: The Elements of User Experience
description: An essential guide to the layers and processes involved in creating great user experiences on the web.

author: Alan Cooper
title: About Face: The Essentials of Interaction Design
description: A comprehensive guide to interaction design, covering principles, patterns, and personas.

author: Kim Goodwin
title: Designing for the Digital Age
description: A practical guide to creating effective designs for complex digital products and systems.

author: Leah Buley
title: The User Experience Team of One
description: A survival guide for solo UX practitioners in companies without formal UX teams.

author: Indi Young
title: Mental Models
description: Introduces a powerful method for understanding user behavior and designing better experiences based on users' thought processes.

author: Peter Morville and Louis Rosenfeld
title: Information Architecture for the World Wide Web
description: A classic guide to organizing and structuring content for websites and digital products.
